title: _act_
author: _act_
created_time: July 27, 2023, 08:10:58 AMLast edit: July 27, 2023, 08:21:10 AM by _act_
content: I saw this not long ago:https://www.reddit.com/r/CryptoCurrency/comments/15artmb/redditors_hacked_bitcoin_is_a_lesson_on_the/https://www.coingabbar.com/en/crypto-shorts-news/redditors-bitcoin-hack-exposes-paper-wallet-perilshttps://cointelegraph.com/news/redditor-gets-lesson-after-bitcoin-paper-wallet-hackedThe links are referring to the same RedditorQuoteMy Bitcoin was taken. How?" A Reddit user thought they were following best practices until two days ago when their Bitcoin wallet was completely cleaned out.He said he used a good way to generate a paper wallet. HD wallet was created a very long time why are people still using the unsafe way to generate paper wallet.There are many HD wallets available that can be used. Example is Electrum.I checked the site on this forum, it has been known for scam vulnerabily since 2018. TryNinja, please edit this your 2017 post: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2047618.msg20403112#msg20403112Re: walletgenerator.net, I find no way to verify the download with PGPDisclosure: Key generation vulnerability found on WalletGenerator.netIt was known to be a good site before, but now it is vulnerable that you will lose your coins if you use the site. I am wondering that someone will not make good research before using those generators. It is not good to even use JavaScript again to generate paper wallet. To generate a paper wallet, use HD wallet. How can a scam site like this be taken down?

comments.author: cloxy
comments.body: The website walletgenerator dot net was actually sold in 2017. Regardless of that, nobody should have assumed that it was ever safe.https://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/kullxn/two_out_of_the_top_three_paper_wallet_generation/https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2019/05/27/researcher-discovers-serious-vulnerability-in-paper-crypto-wallet-site/https://medium.com/mycrypto/disclosure-key-generation-vulnerability-found-on-walletgenerator-net-potentially-malicious-3d8936485961 The domain resolves to 185.178.208.185 which is in Russia, this IP has been flagged several times for abuse...https://www.criminalip.io/en/asset/report/185.178.208.185

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.created_time: July 27, 2023, 02:56:12 PMLast edit: July 27, 2023, 04:49:38 PM by LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on July 27, 2023, 08:10:58 AMHow can a scam site like this be taken down?Complain to their webhost (after which they'll move) or domain name registrar. It might work.It's really bad that 2 scamsites have been making victims for many years. Related reading: here.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on July 27, 2023, 08:10:58 AMIt was known to be a good site before, but now it is vulnerable that you will lose your coins if you use the site. I am wondering that someone will not make good research before using those generators. It is not good to even use JavaScript again to generate paper wallet. To generate a paper wallet, use HD wallet. How can a scam site like this be taken down?You can blame Google, they show these sites as a first search result for words like wallet generator, generate bitcoin address, paper wallet, and they may also tell the user, generate the key offline to ensure that your coins are not stolen.even open-source wallets can be completely flawed if the entropy that generates the private key or seed is not completely random or is written in pseudo-random.I don't want to say that there are still people who trust Blockchain.com, atomic wallet and exodus wallet and those are not newbies.

comments.author: CODE200
comments.body: I'm a bit confused how the scam works so correct me if I'm wrong about what I think it is. Does it mean that the scammers have access to the generated wallet that you generate in the website? I don't lurk too much here so I am not familiar with these kind of scam, I mostly see fake airdrops, social engineering and good old-fashioned pyramid schemes.I don't get why people use obscure sites to create their wallets, store their bitcoins, to trade and to even gamble, I want to know why? To be different? There's probably more reasonable answer that I can't think of.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: CODE200 on July 27, 2023, 04:19:55 PMDoes it mean that the scammers have access to the generated wallet that you generate in the website?From what I've seen, the code is altered to create known private keys, even when used offline. Read my crazy idea (which I never attempted).QuoteI don't get why people use obscure sites to create their walletsIt could have been a trusted site back in the days, until it got sold.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on July 27, 2023, 03:18:52 PMYou can blame Google, they show these sites as a first search result for words like wallet generator, generate bitcoin address, paper wallet, and they may also tell the user, generate the key offline to ensure that your coins are not stolen. Google doesn't care, nor do they carry out any research whether certain sites are scams or not. It's also possible to purchase ad space and advertise scams in Google ads to other users. Remember when ChipMixer was still alive and you couldn't find the official website on Google? At the same time, there were loads of phishing sites that appeared on top of the search results. It's the same with other mixers, like Sinbad. The phishing versions aren't the first result, but they still appear close to the top.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Is this scam still running  ----> Vulnerability discovered on bitcoinpaperwallet[.]com - DO NOT USE ITpaperwallet has a long history of being a bad wallet for the privacy and security of users, even open-source ones may contain backdoors, so it is a good option for developers only and only use those that have been thoroughly reviewed by many developers.I created the topic above in 2020 and unfortunately this scam site is still working.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: Never ever use these 3rd party services that claim to generate "paper wallets". Paper wallet is nothing but a QR code printed on a piece of paper which has your private key. You can print or hand write your private key on a piece of paper yourself and it will instantly become a paper wallet. Or don't make it this complicated just write down your seed words. That's it.To generate your seed words/priv keys, you should use a trusted wallet app like electrum/bitcoin core. I personally use electrum and never had a problem.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on July 27, 2023, 08:10:58 AMHe said he used a good way to generate a paper wallet. HD wallet was created a very long time why are people still using the unsafe way to generate paper wallet.In the presence of safer alternatives such as hardware wallets and others, the paper wallets that are generated through walletgenerator[.]net or any of the other generator sites are wallets that are not completely secure and scams, and the private keys generated for these wallets fall into the hands of scammers and are generated with the same keys with other users. If the user of these paper wallets generates a wallet for him and deposits his funds, he finds that his funds after a certain time have been transferred and stolen to another wallet. Many years ago and there are many accusations of scams about the Walletgenerator site. There are many old members who warned against using it, and unfortunately, the domain is still not suspended yet and works well, but Metamask has flagged it as a deceptive site.QuoteDomain Name: WALLETGENERATOR.NETRegistry Domain ID: 1848992026_DOMAIN_NET-VRSNRegistrar WHOIS Server: whois.namecheap.comRegistrar URL: http://www.namecheap.comCreation Date: March 3, 2014Update Date: April 26, 2023Expiration Date: March 3, 2029Age: 9 years, 149 daysSOURCE: https://www.domainiq.com/domain?walletgenerator.net#/whoisGuys check out this article and report: How and where can I file abuse complaints to Namecheap?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on July 27, 2023, 08:10:58 AMTo generate a paper wallet, use HD wallet.Hoe about to users who doesnt have any HD wallets? Just use trusted open source wallet generator and generate wallet address in offline device.Quote from: _act_ on July 27, 2023, 08:10:58 AMHow can a scam site like this be taken down?Report it on its hosting i checked i uses namecheap. Go submit a ticket -> abuse report -> prohibited/illegal contentI just report the site and referenced the reddits thread and its the news articles.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on July 27, 2023, 02:56:12 PMIt's really bad that 2 scamsites have been making victims for many years. Jesus, that is bad.  I don't know enough about SEO in order to personally lay blame on Google, but if the original owners had gotten the site to the top of Google's search results for "paper wallet" or whatever keywords caused the site to pop up to the top, the buyer of the site got really lucky and bought a scammer's gold mine.  And no doubt if the site stays up it'll keep sucking in the newcomers and/or those that don't know enough not to create a paper wallet like that.  It'd be awesome if this thread showed up somewhere near walletgeneratordotnet in search results....any chance that could happen?

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on July 28, 2023, 12:07:40 AMIt'd be awesome if this thread showed up somewhere near walletgeneratordotnet in search results....any chance that could happen?Among the search engines, especially Google, it cares more about money not protection or privacy. Google do not care about the people that are using their services. But what can most likely make this occur is if this thread is getting replies from time to time. This would be good for people that make searches like 'is walletgeneratordotnet a scam site or not', but if the person search for something like paper wallet genetor, this is what I found which is the scam site.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on July 28, 2023, 08:32:33 AMQuote from: The Sceptical Chymist on July 28, 2023, 12:07:40 AMIt'd be awesome if this thread showed up somewhere near walletgeneratordotnet in search results....any chance that could happen?Among the search engines, especially Google, it cares more about money not protection or privacy. Google do not care about the people that are using their services. But what can most likely make this occur is if this thread is getting replies from time to time. This would be good for people that make searches like 'is walletgeneratordotnet a scam site or not', but if the person search for something like paper wallet genetor, this is what I found which is the scam site.This is true, but it is not the main reason, the search engines show the sites that were created in the past first*, and since the site was created on March 3, 2014, it will definitely be first in the search engines, even if it is scam.I'm going to report them to namecheap and hope everyone does.* This may not be true in all cases, but even ads are customized based on several factors, and one of the factors is this factor.

comments.author: CODE200
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on July 27, 2023, 04:51:42 PMQuote from: CODE200 on July 27, 2023, 04:19:55 PM~From what I've seen, the code is altered to create known private keys, even when used offline. Read my crazy idea (which I never attempted).I asked my programmer friend the same question, the mf told me that's how custodial wallets work in a condescending tone lmao. Your's though is a sneaky one, no newbie or casual bitcoin enjoyer will check if their private keys are public so it's a goddamn good scam, but good in a vile way though(saying this for legal purposes).Quote from: LoyceV on July 27, 2023, 04:51:42 PMQuote from: CODE200 on July 27, 2023, 04:19:55 PM~It could have been a trusted site back in the days, until it got sold.Oh, never considered that possibility so thank you! I'm bookmarking that thread for future reference. This scam is 3 years old already, damn. I wonder how @canton takes it that he sold it to a scammer or it became a scam website.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on July 28, 2023, 01:07:18 PMI'm going to report them to namecheap and hope everyone does.* This may not be true in all cases, but even ads are customized based on several factors, and one of the factors is this factor.I also reported, I do not know if these reports are useful and give a good result, but perhaps if there are a large number of them, it will definitely give a positive result, so as you mentioned, I hope everyone reports, not only this fraudulent site, but all suspicious sites. This will help prevent further fraud victims.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.created_time: July 28, 2023, 10:16:31 PMLast edit: July 28, 2023, 10:30:32 PM by khaled0111
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on July 27, 2023, 03:18:52 PMYou can blame Google, they show these sites as a first search result for words like wallet generator, generate bitcoin address, paper wallet, and they may also tell the user, generate the key offline to ensure that your coins are not stolen.even open-source wallets can be completely flawed if the entropy that generates the private key or seed is not completely random or is written in pseudo-random.You can try reporting the website to "Google safe browsing": https://safebrowsing.google.com/safebrowsing/report_phish/Maybe they will remove it from their search results if many people report it. There is a field where you can explain why you think the reported website is not safe and should be banned.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on July 28, 2023, 01:07:18 PMThis is true, but it is not the main reason, the search engines show the sites that were created in the past first*, and since the site was created on March 3, 2014, it will definitely be first in the search engines, even if it is scam.This is not always the case. There are many factors that affect to make a site in the first place/rank in the search engine page. The scam site is well written with lots of keywords on it, especially the FAQ that always give users information which make google thinks that its a well quality page, back links, plus its domain age. I report it on namecheap as well as what i mentioned above, i hope people will mass report it too.Quote from: khaled0111 on July 28, 2023, 10:16:31 PMYou can try reporting the website to "Google safe browsing": https://safebrowsing.google.com/safebrowsing/report_phish/Maybe they will remove it from their search results if many people report it. It's not a phishing site, so google wont prioritize to remove it. Well, i hope so, but its better to report it on their registrar — namecheap.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: khaled0111 on July 28, 2023, 10:16:31 PMYou can try reporting the website to "Google safe browsing": https://safebrowsing.google.com/safebrowsing/report_phish/I haven't seen a result from those reports in years. Google doesn't care, and I gave up.QuoteMaybe they will remove it from their search results if many people report it.Reporting bad sites shouldn't be a petition that needs to be signed many times.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on July 29, 2023, 07:45:07 AMQuote from: khaled0111 on July 28, 2023, 10:16:31 PMYou can try reporting the website to "Google safe browsing": https://safebrowsing.google.com/safebrowsing/report_phish/I haven't seen a result from those reports in years. Google doesn't care, and I gave up.QuoteMaybe they will remove it from their search results if many people report it.Reporting bad sites shouldn't be a petition that needs to be signed many times.But this is not only about Google, the site needs to be taken down. I use other search engines just now and I even try it on tor but the same scam site is what I am seeing as first on the search engines including duckduckgo. The government were able to take down mixers but unable to taken down these scam paper wallet generator websites.Not that I am supporting google too, google services are the places where scammers and hackers are living and successfully doing their work.
